div.p: Z71/120, unit 576, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to enquire, whether you would approve of my paying the orphan-boys of the industrial school here at work a daily remuneration of 1d, such to be placed monthly for them into the saving bank. The wages fund of the bot Garden would not admit of giving them more, but I think, that however trifling this pay may be it will act as an encouragement; besides it will give me the power to withhold it, should at any time one of the boys not show a proper behavior or a want of diligence.

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary
On 6 January 1871 the Under Secretary, William Odgers, referred M's request to the Inspector of Industrial Schools 'for his remarks'. get name from Blue Books replied on 9 January 1871: 'I see no objections to the small payments suggested by Dr Mueller being made to the boys. If approved the amount should be sent to me quarterly, to be placed to the [collect/credit?] of the boys in the post office Savings Branch —'. McCulloch referred the matter to the 'Branch' on 12 January 1871. What does this mean?
